alert.note: Alert for Adams; Clay; Fillmore; Hall; Hamilton; Nuckolls; Webster; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 18 at 4:03PM CST until January 18 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Clay County in south central Nebraska... Northwestern Nuckolls County in south central Nebraska... Northern Webster County in south central Nebraska... Adams County in south central Nebraska... York County in east central Nebraska... Hamilton County in south central Nebraska... Northwestern Fillmore County in south central Nebraska... Southeastern Hall County in south central Nebraska... * Until 445 PM CST. * At 402 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Marquette to Hastings to near Norman, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 320 and 365. Locations impacted include... Hastings, York, Aurora, Sutton, Harvard, Henderson, Blue Hill, Clay Center, Juniata, Edgar, Hampton, McCool Junction, Fairfield, Giltner, Glenvil, Lawrence, Bradshaw, Bladen, Waco, and Roseland. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT

area.areaDesc: Adams; Clay; Fillmore; Hall; Hamilton; Nuckolls; Webster; York
